data.title: It's always a great dinner and fun evening
data.text: I've been to White Star over a dozen times. I've also hosted a Family Birthday and Class Reunion there in their private party rooms. Working with Jason and his staff were excellent. Both events got rave reviews.I have nothing but positive comments about the entire staff. The food is excellent and their bar (esp the beer choices) are the best in the city.  I love the tall ceilings and big windows. It's only a block away from the Doubletree Hotel. Check it out. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Great service
data.text: Was in town on business and this was close to our hotel.  I had the pistachio chicken, WAY to much breading you couldn't even find the chicken.  The loaded hash brown potatoes were good.  Margarita was very strong, couldn't even drink it.  The bright spot was our waiter.  He was excellent, and personable.  Good job to him!

data.title: Love the moose in the bar
data.text: Found this restaurant on TA. It's worth the trip downtown. Food has been great on both occasions we have visited. Missed it last time because of the flooding. Will definitely make a return visit!

data.title: A few drinks with friends
data.text:
Great place to meet friends.  Unfortunately we did not eat here, however the service and selection of beers was good. 
I always come here when on town.
Good bar.

data.title: Nice selection of beers, tasty food
data.text: Very nice selection of beers.  Food portions were huge! And very well prepared.  Staff was super pleasant and knowledgeable

data.title: Nice!
data.text: We came here a lot in the summertime after Uptown Saturday nights. I highly recommend the cheese wontons!

data.title: Good food, big place
data.text: Excellent menu, good food, big place, loads of excellent beers on tap! Staff was little overcrowded and main course arrived before starters were finished. That set aside, good meal!!

data.title: Great food, service and drinks!
data.text:
First of all, we had a group of 10 and our waiter was fantastic.  He was engaging, funny and very prompt.  Our drinks and appetizers were great as well as the atmosphere.

I ordered the Iowa cut pork chop for my meal and I was not disappointed.  It was cooked and seasoned wonderfully.

I would definitely visit again when in town.

data.title: Nice Atmosphere!
data.text: Great drinks and really good food make this a perfect place for a romantic dinner or dinner out with friends. The bar is busy, but the bartenders are friendly and there is a fun and friendly atmosphere. More upscale than some, the prices are reasonable.

data.title: Fantastic wee place
data.text: Visited here last week whilst staying in benidorm. Fantastic staff, great drinks and free crisps and nuts with your drinks.  Husband sang on karaoke and we had great fun.

data.title: Excellent dining experience
data.text: Enjoyed a terrific roast prime rib along with very nice glass of red wine. Waiter was unusually pleasant and helpful.

data.title: Great location, great use of old building
data.text: Food and drinks are good, but spendy. Wonderful atmosphere for large group or intimate get together. Very good service.

data.title: Dinner after a long drive
data.text:
Found White Star online overall I would say after a long drive it wasn't the place for us.  We were expecting a laid back place but it was more upscale than we needed. The food wasn't bad, too much cheese though, servers were excellent, a little pricey but the beer selection was good.

Not their fault but Google maps had the place on the wrong side of the street and parking was difficult.  

Would I go there again, sure but only after being in town a day or two.

data.title: Yuck
data.text: My husband and kids wanted to take me somewhere nice for my birthday dinner. We chose this place based on the #7 spot. The bag of garbage in front of the door should have been a hint. We were greeted quickly by the hostess then seated right away. We sat for several minutes watching servers walk by. They were not busy at all. We finally got tired of waiting and got up to leave. The manager managed to pull himself off the couch in the lobby to tell us he would buy our dinner if we stayed.  He did not seem to care about why we were unhappy. We finally got a server and ordered our food. Most of it was cold. Sent some back, it came back burnt. Service was ok, once we got it.

data.title: Chicken fingers!!!
data.text: The chicken fingers were among the best chicken fingers I've ever had. I went there two days in a row and ordered them both times and was obsessed. My other family members ordered other food and enjoyed t as well. The side of potatoes that you can get are extremely good- I forgot what they are called but we all enjoyed them. Service is slow but I didn't mind.

data.title: Great date night!
data.text: We love White Star Ale House!  We love that they have private booths for date night!  We have also taken our kids here and that has also been very pleasant.  We love the food that is all homemade on site and the extras the chefs do to make each plate look beautiful.  Can't wait to go back!

data.title: #7? Would hate to eat at Cedar Rapid's #8
data.text:
Point blank...this place just sucks. We were seated immediately upon arrival as they were not busy. We sat for ten minutes waiting for one of the servers to at least say hi. Maybe a glass of water? Did they all think we came to their restaurant to just sit and stare at each other? So we decided to leave.  As we headed out the door the manager caught us and insisted that he pay for our meal and we stay to eat. As we tried to explain why we wanted to leave he kept saying "I know, I know, I know...we made a mistake...it happens." 
Unfortunately we decided to take him up on his offer and stay to eat. The food was very cold. Hard to complain about a free meal but cold is cold and it absolutely ruins an already bad experience. 
They do have a great beer selection, but who doesn't anymore? 
Once we got our server, he was very polite and did an excellent job. The new server he was training is fortunate to be trained by such a good mentor. Hopefully they both will go work at a better ran restaurant so they can make better tips.

data.title: Excellent food, poor service
data.text: The food was beyond excellent-I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. The service, however, left a lot to be desired. Although one server was very personable and helpful, the other made us decide we would never return and would never recommend White Ale to others. She talked down about Cedar Rapids, the people in Cedar Rapids and essentially everyone who would frequent the bar. She then insulted our drink orders. Two words: PBR tattoo. Will not be returning.

data.title: Enjoyable Bar Dinner
data.text:
I was in town for a Monday meeting so on Sunday night I went to White Star for dinner. I was solo so I sat at the bar and was served by Ben. Nice guy that knew his draft beers which was good for me because there are a lot of choices. I started with chicken lettuce wraps which were very different from what I used to at places like PF Changs. These were thick tenderloin sizes pieces and I'm not sure what the type of lettuce was but it was more green. The chicken was perfectly seasoned and cooked. 

I had the NYC Peppers & Sausage for dinner and couldn't eat but 1/3 of it. It's a huge mound of pasta. The sauce is a fire-roasted deep flavor and the sausage was nicely spiced. It came with a salad which had great bacon bits and capers. 

Cool place and I'd definitely go back.

data.title: Need to use seasoning
data.text: I don't usually write comments but today I had to . I think this was the worst food I had for a long time . Our food had no flavor at all . My daughter ask for her beef tenderloin med. And it rare no salt or seasoning at all ,the cheesy potatoes tasted out of a box. My season chicken sandwich didn't taste like anything. Appetizer very greasy. The best thing we had was the fries .
